habitat_description: Range of the eastern glass lizard expands from the Coastal Plain of the southeastern United states into southeastern Virginia to southern Florida, and west to eastern Louisiana (Conant and Collins 1991). This lizard inhabits moist and dry areas, including damp grassy areas, maritime forests, open and scrubby woods (mesic hammock, pine flatwoods) (Schwartz and Henderson 1991, Bartlett and Bartlett 1999). Schwartz and Henderson (1991) have also reported the introduction and establishment of the eastern glass lizard in the Grand Cayman Island, Cayman Islands.
